jsoul.midi

Class Note

  • java.lang.Object
    • jsoul.midi.Note
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Note>, Playable

    public class Note
extends java.lang.Object
implements Playable, java.lang.Comparable<Note>
    Represents a MIDI node, with a pitch, velocity, and duration.
    Author:
    Andrew Goldin

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int EIGHTH
      The midi duration of an eighth note, measured in ticks, where 1 tick is assumed to be one 16th of a beat.
      static int HALF
      The midi duration of a half note, measured in ticks, where 1 tick is assumed to be one 16th of a beat.
      static java.lang.String[] KEYNAMES
      The list of 12 key names contained within an octave, from C up to B.
      static int QUARTER
      The midi duration of a quarter note, measured in ticks, where 1 tick is assumed to be one 16th of a beat.
      static int SIXTEENTH
      The midi duration of a sixteenth note, measured in ticks, where 1 tick is assumed to be one 16th of a beat.
      static int SIXTYFOURTH
      The midi duration of a 64th note, measured in ticks, where 1 tick is assumed to be one 16th of a beat.
      static int THIRTYSECOND
      The midi duration of a 32nd note, measured in ticks, where 1 tick is assumed to be one 16th of a beat.
      static int WHOLE
      The midi duration of a whole note, measured in ticks, where 1 tick is assumed to be one 16th of a beat.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Note()
      Default constructor: Creates middle C, mezzoforte, whole note.
      Note(int p, int v, int d)
      Constructs a new note given a pitch value (0-127), velocity value (0-127), and a duration value in ticks.
      Note(java.lang.String p, int v, int d)
      Constructs a new note given a key name, velocity value (0-127), and a duration value in ticks.

      • Note

        public Note(int p,
    int v,
    int d)
        Constructs a new note given a pitch value (0-127), velocity value (0-127), and a duration value in ticks.

        p - the pitch
        v - the velocity
        d - the duration

      • Note

        public Note(java.lang.String p,
    int v,
    int d)
        Constructs a new note given a key name, velocity value (0-127), and a duration value in ticks. Example key names include "C4" (middle C), "Eb5", "G#2", etc.
        Parameters:
        p - the key name as a String
        v - the velocity
        d - the duration

      • Note

        public Note()
        Default constructor: Creates middle C, mezzoforte, whole note.

      • transpose

        public void transpose(int steps)
        Tranposes the note up or down by the specified number of half steps. If the number of steps would cause the note to leave the 0-127 range, nothing will happen.
        Specified by:
        transpose in interface Playable
        Parameters:
        steps - the number of steps (positive or negative) to transpose the note

        public int getPitch()
        Gets the note's pitch value as an int

        public void setDuration(int d)

      • pitchToString

        public static java.lang.String pitchToString(int pitch)
        Converts a integer pitch value to a String. For example, pitchToString(60) will return "C4".
        Parameters:
        pitch - the pitch value
        Returns:
        the pitch as a String

      • stringToPitch

        public static int stringToPitch(java.lang.String s)
        Converts a String representation of a pitch to an int. For example, stringToPitch("C4") will return 60.
        Parameters:
        s - the pitch String representation
        Returns:
        the pitch midi value (0-127)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the Note, giving pitch, velocity, and duration.
        Overrides:

        Returns:

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Note other)
        Compares this note to another Note by pitch.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Note>
        Returns:
        a negative value if the pitch is lower, positive if higher, 0 if equal
